inputs.name: mavenPOMFile
inputs.label: Maven POM file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repo root to the `Maven POM file`.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish to VSO/TFS
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to publish JUnit Test results produced by the Maven build to VSO/TFS. Each test result file matching `Test Results Files` will be published as a test run in VSO/TFS.

inputs.name: testResultsFiles
inputs.label: Test Results Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test results files path.  Wildcards can be used.  For example, `**/TEST-*.xml` for all xml files whose name starts with TEST-.

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.label: Test Run Title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the Test Run.

inputs.name: classFilter
inputs.label: Class Inclusion/Exclusion Filters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma separated list of filters to include or exclude classes from collecting code coverage. For example, +:com.*,+:org.*,-:my.app*.*. Refer http://www.eclemma.org/jacoco/trunk/doc/maven.html.

inputs.name: classFilesDirectories
inputs.label: Class Files Directories
inputs.helpMarkDown: This field is required for a multi module project. Code coverage reports are created using ANT task. Comma separated list of directories containing class files, archive files(jar, war etc.). Directories and archives are searched recursively for class files. Code coverage is reported for class files present in the directories. For example, classes1/Tests,classes2/Tests2. Refer http://www.eclemma.org/jacoco/trunk/doc/ant.html

inputs.name: srcDirectories
inputs.label: Source Files Directories
inputs.helpMarkDown: This field is required for a multi module project. Code coverage reports are created using ANT task. Specify source directories for code coverage reports to include highlighted source code. For example, src/java,src/Test. Refer http://www.eclemma.org/jacoco/trunk/doc/ant.html

inputs.name: javaHomeSelection
inputs.label: Set JAVA_HOME by
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME either by selecting a JDK version that will be discovered during builds or by manually entering a JDK path.

inputs.name: jdkVersion
inputs.label: JDK Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Will attempt to discover the path to the selected JDK version and set JAVA_HOME accordingly.

inputs.name: jdkUserInputPath
inputs.label: JDK Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME to the given path.

inputs.name: jdkArchitecture
inputs.label: JDK Architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the architecture (x86, x64) of JDK.

inputs.name: sqAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run SonarQube Analysis
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run a [SonarQube](http://www.sonarqube.org/) analysis after executing the current goals. 'install' or 'package' goals should be executed first.

inputs.name: sqConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: SonarQube Endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: The endpoint that specifies the SonarQube server to use

inputs.name: sqDbDetailsRequired
inputs.label: The SonarQube server version is lower than 5.2
inputs.helpMarkDown: If using a SonarQube server 5.1 or lower you need to specify the database connection details.

inputs.name: sqDbUrl
inputs.label: Db Connection String
inputs.helpMarkDown: SonarQube server 5.1 and lower only. The database connection setting i.e. sonar.jdbc.url. For example jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://localhost/sonar;SelectMethod=Cursor

inputs.name: sqDbUsername
inputs.label: Db UserName
inputs.helpMarkDown: SonarQube server 5.1 and lower only. The username for the database user i.e. sonar.jdbc.username.

inputs.name: sqDbPassword
inputs.label: Db User Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: SonarQube server 5.1 and lower only. The password for the database user i.e. sonar.jdbc.password
